comment.text: Calcium-regulated non-lysosomal thiol-protease which catalyzes limited proteolysis of substrates involved in cytoskeletal remodeling and signal transduction. Proteolytically cleaves MYOC at 'Arg-226' (PubMed:17650508). Proteolytically cleaves CPEB3 following neuronal stimulation which abolishes CPEB3 translational repressor activity, leading to translation of CPEB3 target mRNAs (By similarity).
Activated by 200-1000 micromolar concentrations of calcium and inhibited by calpastatin.
Forms a heterodimer with a small (regulatory) subunit (CAPNS1). Interacts with CPEB3; this leads to cleavage of CPEB3.
Translocates to the plasma membrane upon Ca(2+) binding.
Belongs to the peptidase C2 family.

property.value: Deregulated CDK5 triggers multiple neurodegenerative pathways in Alzheimer's disease models
Expressed in nasal cavity epithelium and 244 other tissues
P:cellular response to amino acid stimulus
P:positive regulation of cardiac muscle cell apoptotic process
P:positive regulation of phosphatidylcholine biosynthetic process
P:proteolysis involved in cellular protein catabolic process
